intro: Porterandia kelantansis, commonly known as the Kelantan thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. It produces small, round berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
